tl.Slick

Class ShaderProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • tl.Slick.ShaderProgram

  • public class ShaderProgram
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple wrapper utility for creating and reusing shaders and shader programs.
    Author:
    davedes

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShaderProgram

        public ShaderProgram(java.lang.String vertexShaderSource,
             java.lang.String fragShaderSource)
              throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Creates a new shader program with the given vertex and fragment shader source code. The given source code is compiled, then the shaders attached and linked. If shaders are not supported on this system (isSupported returns false), a SlickException will be thrown. If one of the shaders does not compile successfully, a SlickException will be thrown. If there was a problem in linking the shaders to the program, a SlickException will be thrown and the program will be deleted.
        Parameters:
        vertexShaderSource - the shader code to compile, attach and link
        fragShaderSource - the frag code to compile, attach and link
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - if there was an issue
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there was an issue

    • Method Detail

      • isSupported

        public static boolean isSupported()
        Returns true if GLSL shaders are supported in hardware on this system. This checks for the following OpenGL extensions: GL_ARB_shader_objects, GL_ARB_vertex_shader, GL_ARB_fragment_shader
        Returns:
        true if shaders are supported

      • setStrictMode

        public static void setStrictMode(boolean enabled)
        Whether shader programs are to use "strict" uniform/attribute name checking. That is, when strict mode is enabled, trying to modify or retrieve uniform/attribute data by name will fail and throw an IllegalArgumentException if there exists no 'active' uniforms/attributes by the given name. (In GLSL, declared uniforms might still be "inactive" if they are not used.) If strict mode is disabled, getting/setting uniform/attribute data will fail silently if the name is not found.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable strict mode

      • isStrictMode

        public static boolean isStrictMode()
        Returns true if shader programs are to use "strict" uniform/attribute name checking. That is, when strict mode is enabled, trying to modify or retrieve uniform/attribute data by name will fail and throw an IllegalArgumentException if there exists no 'active' uniforms/attributes by the given name. (In GLSL, declared uniforms might still be "inactive" if they are not used.) If strict mode is disabled, getting/setting uniform/attribute data will fail silently if the name is not found.
        Returns:
        true if strict mode is enabled

      • unbindAll

        public static void unbindAll()
        Disables shaders.

      • loadProgram

        public static ShaderProgram loadProgram(java.lang.String vertFile,
                        java.lang.String fragFile)
                                 throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        A convenience method to load a ShaderProgram from two text files.
        Parameters:
        vertFile - the location of the vertex shader source
        fragFile - the location of the frag shader source
        Returns:
        the compiled and linked ShaderProgram
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - if there was an issue reading the file, compiling the source, or linking the program

      • readFile

        public static java.lang.String readFile(java.lang.String ref)
                                 throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Loads the given input stream into a source code string.
        Parameters:
        ref - the location of the text file
        Returns:
        the resulting source code String
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - if there was an issue reading the source

      • readFile

                                 throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Loads the given input stream into a source code string.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream
        Returns:
        the resulting source code String
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - if there was an issue reading the source

      • getLog

        public java.lang.String getLog()
        Returns the full log of compiling/linking errors, info, warnings, etc.
        Returns:
        the full log of this ShaderProgram

      • bind

        public void bind()
        Enables this shader for use -- only one shader can be bound at a time. Calling bind() when another program is bound will simply make this object the active program.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this program is invalid

      • unbind

        public void unbind()
        Unbinds all shaders; this is the equivalent of ShaderProgram.unbindAll(), and only included for consistency with bind() and the rest of the API (i.e. startUse/endUse). Users do not need to unbind one shader before binding a new one.

      • releaseShaders

        public void releaseShaders()
        Disables shaders (unbind), then detaches and releases the shaders associated with this program. This can be called after linking a program in order to free up memory (as the shaders are no longer needed), however, since it is not a commonly used feature and thus not well tested on all drivers, it should be used with caution. Shaders shouldn't be used after being released.

      • release

        public void release()
        If this program has not yet been released, this will disable shaders (unbind), then releases this program and its shaders. To only release the shaders (not the program itself), call releaseShaders(). Programs will be considered "invalid" after being released, and should no longer be used.

      • getVertexShaderID

        public int getVertexShaderID()
        Returns the OpenGL handle for this program's vertex shader.
        Returns:
        the vertex ID

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Returns the OpenGL handle for this shader program
        Returns:
        the program ID

      • valid

        public boolean valid()
        A shader program is "valid" if it's ID is not zero. Upon releasing a program, the ID will be set to zero.
        Returns:
        whether this program is valid

        Returns:

        Returns:
        an array list of active attribute names

      • getUniformNames

        public java.lang.String[] getUniformNames()
        Returns the names of all active uniforms that were found when linking the program.
        Returns:
        an array list of active uniform names

      • enableVertexAttribute

        public boolean enableVertexAttribute(java.lang.String name)
        Enables the vertex array -- in strict mode, if the vertex attribute is not found (or it's inactive), an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. If strict mode is disabled and the vertex attribute is not found, this method will return false otherwise it will return true.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the vertex attribute to enable
        Returns:
        false if strict mode is disabled and this attribute couldn't be found

      • disableVertexAttribute

        public boolean disableVertexAttribute(java.lang.String name)
        Disables the vertex array -- in strict mode, if the vertex attribute is not found (or it's inactive), an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. If strict mode is disabled and the vertex attribute is not found, this method will return false otherwise it will return true.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the vertex attribute to disable
        Returns:
        false if strict mode is disabled and this attribute couldn't be found

      • setUniform4f

        public void setUniform4f(java.lang.String name,
                org.newdawn.slick.Color color)
        Sets the value of an RGBA vec4 uniform to the given color
        Parameters:
        name - the RGBA vec4 uniform
        color - the color to assign

      • setUniform2f

        public void setUniform2f(java.lang.String name,
                org.newdawn.slick.geom.Vector2f vec)
        Sets the value of a vec2 uniform to the given Vector2f.
        Parameters:
        name - the vec2 uniform
        vec - the vector to use

      • getUniform1i

        public int getUniform1i(java.lang.String name)
        A convenience method to retrieve an integer/sampler2D uniform.
        Parameters:
        name - the uniform name
        Returns:
        the value

      • getUniform2i

        public int[] getUniform2i(java.lang.String name)
        A convenience method to retrieve an ivec2 uniform; for maximum performance and memory efficiency you should use getUniform(String, IntBuffer) with a shared buffer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the uniform
        Returns:
        a newly created int[] array with 2 elements; e.g. (x, y)

      • getUniform3i

        public int[] getUniform3i(java.lang.String name)
        A convenience method to retrieve an ivec3 uniform; for maximum performance and memory efficiency you should use getUniform(String, IntBuffer) with a shared buffer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the uniform
        Returns:
        a newly created int[] array with 3 elements; e.g. (x, y, z)

      • getUniform4i

        public int[] getUniform4i(java.lang.String name)
        A convenience method to retrieve an ivec4 uniform; for maximum performance and memory efficiency you should use getUniform(String, IntBuffer) with a shared buffer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the uniform
        Returns:
        a newly created int[] array with 2 elements; e.g. (r, g, b, a)

        public float[] getUniform4f(java.lang.String name)

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the uniform
        Returns:
        a newly created float[] array with 4 elements; e.g. (r, g, b, a)

      • getUniform

        public boolean getUniform(java.lang.String name,
                 java.nio.FloatBuffer buf)
        Retrieves data from a uniform and places it in the given buffer. If strict mode is enabled, this will throw an IllegalArgumentException if the given uniform is not 'active' -- i.e. if GLSL determined that the shader isn't using it. If strict mode is disabled, this method will return true if the uniform was found, and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the uniform
        buf - the buffer to place the data
        Returns:
        true if the uniform was found, false if there is no active uniform by that name

      • getUniform

        public boolean getUniform(java.lang.String name,
                 java.nio.IntBuffer buf)
        Retrieves data from a uniform and places it in the given buffer. If strict mode is enabled, this will throw an IllegalArgumentException if the given uniform is not 'active' -- i.e. if GLSL determined that the shader isn't using it. If strict mode is disabled, this method will return true if the uniform was found, and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the uniform
        buf - the buffer to place the data
        Returns:
        true if the uniform was found, false if there is no active uniform by that name

      • hasUniform

        public boolean hasUniform(java.lang.String name)
        Whether the shader program was linked with the active uniform by the given name. A uniform might be "inactive" even if it was declared at the top of a shader; if GLSL finds that a uniform isn't needed (i.e. not used in shader), then it will not be active.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the uniform
        Returns:
        true if this shader program could find the active uniform

      • hasAttribute

        public boolean hasAttribute(java.lang.String name)
        Whether the shader program was linked with the active attribute by the given name. A attribute might be "inactive" even if it was declared at the top of a shader; if GLSL finds that a attribute isn't needed (i.e. not used in shader), then it will not be active.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the attribute
        Returns:
        true if this shader program could find the active attribute

        public void setUniform1f(java.lang.String name,
                float f)
        Sets the value of a float uniform.
        Parameters:
        name - the uniform by name
        f - the float value

                int i)
        Sets the value of a sampler2D uniform.
        Parameters:
        name - the uniform by name
        i - the integer / active texture (e.g. 0 for TEXTURE0)

                float a,

        Sets the value of a vec2 uniform.
        Parameters:

        a - vec.x / tex.s
        b - vec.y / tex.t

        Parameters:

        a - vec.x / color.r / tex.s
        b - vec.y / color.g / tex.t
        c - vec.z / color.b / tex.p

              boolean transpose,
              java.nio.FloatBuffer buf)

        Parameters:
